vocabulary.definition: magical and wonderful
vocabulary.example: The enchanted forest sparkled with fairy dust

vocabulary.definition: having special powers that seem impossible
vocabulary.example: The wizard had a magical wand that could grant wishes

vocabulary.definition: a large stone building where kings and queens live
vocabulary.example: The princess lived in a tall castle with many towers

vocabulary.definition: a huge imaginary creature that can breathe fire
vocabulary.example: The brave knight fought the fierce dragon

vocabulary.definition: a long journey to find something important
vocabulary.example: The hero went on a quest to find the golden treasure

vocabulary.definition: a country ruled by a king or queen
vocabulary.example: The peaceful kingdom was protected by brave knights

vocabulary.definition: magic words that make something happen
vocabulary.example: The fairy cast a spell to help the lost children

vocabulary.definition: an imaginary horse with one horn on its head
vocabulary.example: The beautiful unicorn had a silver horn and flowing mane

vocabulary.definition: mysterious and full of magic
vocabulary.example: The mystical crystal glowed with inner light

vocabulary.definition: a person who uses magic and spells
vocabulary.example: The wise sorcerer helped the village with his magic

vocabulary.definition: a prediction about what will happen in the future
vocabulary.example: The ancient prophecy said a hero would save the land

vocabulary.definition: famous in stories told for a very long time
vocabulary.example: King Arthur was a legendary ruler with a magical sword

vocabulary.definition: a magical drink that can change things
vocabulary.example: The witch brewed a healing potion in her cauldron

vocabulary.definition: a magical kingdom or world
vocabulary.example: The fairy realm was hidden behind a waterfall

vocabulary.definition: changing from one thing into something completely different
vocabulary.example: The prince's transformation back from a frog was magical

vocabulary.definition: someone who protects and watches over others
vocabulary.example: The dragon was the guardian of the ancient treasure

vocabulary.definition: living forever and never dying
vocabulary.example: The immortal wizard had lived for thousands of years

vocabulary.definition: a magical spell that changes things
vocabulary.example: The enchantment made the whole forest come alive

vocabulary.definition: beyond what is natural or normal
vocabulary.example: The ghost had supernatural powers to walk through walls

vocabulary.definition: special magic words spoken to cast a spell
vocabulary.example: The wizard spoke an ancient incantation to open the door
